templates.title: Ghost
templates.name: Ghost
templates.description: Ghost is a free and open source blogging platform written in JavaScript and distributed under the MIT License, designed to simplify the process of online publishing for individual bloggers as well as online publications.

templates.title: ContentBox
templates.name: ContentBox
templates.description: ContentBox Modular CMS is an open-source content management system for CFML, created by Ortus Solutions, Corp. ContentBox has been designed as a modular HMVC software based on Hibernate ORM and the ColdBox Platform. ContentBox Modular CMS is dual-licensed as Apache v2 or a commercial license.

templates.title: Drupal
templates.name: Drupal
templates.description: Drupal is a free and open-source web content management system written in PHP and distributed under the GNU General Public License.

templates.title: Joomla
templates.name: Joomla
templates.description: Joomla, also spelled Joomla! and sometimes abbreviated as J!, is a free and open-source content management system for publishing web content on websites. Web content applications include discussion forums, photo galleries, e-Commerce and user communities and numerous other web-based applications.

templates.title: Plone
templates.name: Plone
templates.description: Plone is a free and open source content management system built on top of the Zope application server. Plone is positioned as an enterprise CMS and is commonly used for intranets and as part of the web presence of large organizations.

templates.title: WordPress
templates.name: WordPress
templates.description: WordPress is a free and open-source content management system written in PHP and paired with a MySQL or MariaDB database with supported HTTPS. Features include a plugin architecture and a template system, referred to within WordPress as Themes.

env.name: MYSQL_DATABASE_PASSWORD
env.label: Database root password
env.description: Password used by the MySQL root user.

templates.title: WordPress
templates.name: WordPress
templates.description: WordPress setup with a MySQL database

env.name: MYSQL_DATABASE_PASSWORD
env.label: Database root password
env.description: Password used by the MySQL root user.

templates.title: OpenAMT
templates.name: OpenAMT
templates.description: Open Active Management Technology Cloud Toolkit (Open AMT Cloud Toolkit) provides open-source, modular microservices and libraries for integration of IntelÂ® Active Management Technology.

env.name: MPS_COMMON_NAME
env.label: MPS URL
env.description: Used to connect to the MPS API.

env.name: MPS_SECRET
env.label: MPS Secret
env.description: Strong secret key used to log into MPS.

env.name: VAULT_SECRET
env.label: Vault secret
env.description: Secret token used to log into Vault (don't include '.' character).

templates.title: MariaDB
templates.name: MariaDB
templates.description: MariaDB is a community-developed, commercially supported fork of the MySQL relational database management system, intended to remain free and open-source software under the GNU General Public License.

templates.title: MongoDB (NoSQL)
templates.name: MongoDB
templates.description: MongoDB is a source-available cross-platform document-oriented database program. Classified as a NoSQL database program, MongoDB uses JSON-like documents with optional schemas. MongoDB is developed by MongoDB Inc. and licensed under the Server Side Public License which is deemed non-free by several distributions.

templates.title: MySQL
templates.name: MySQL
templates.description: MySQL is an open-source relational database management system. Its name is a combination of My, the name of co-founder Michael Widenius's daughter My, and SQL, the abbreviation for Structured Query Language.

templates.title: PostgreSQL
templates.name: PostgreSQL
templates.description: PostgreSQL, also known as Postgres, is a free and open-source relational database management system emphasizing extensibility and SQL compliance. It was originally named POSTGRES, referring to its origins as a successor to the Ingres database developed at the University of California, Berkeley.

templates.title: Redis
templates.name: Redis
templates.description: Redis is an in-memory data structure store, used as a distributed, in-memory keyâvalue database, cache and message broker, with optional durability. Redis supports different kinds of abstract data structures, such as strings, lists, maps, sets, sorted sets, HyperLogLogs, bitmaps, streams, and spatial indices.

templates.title: CrateDB
templates.name: CrateDB
templates.description: CrateDB is a distributed SQL database management system that integrates a fully searchable document-oriented data store. It is open-source, written in Java, based on a shared-nothing architecture, and designed for high scalability. CrateDB includes components from Trino, Lucene, Elasticsearch and Netty.

templates.title: Microsoft SQL Server (Linux)
templates.name: Microsoft-SQL-Server-Linux
templates.description: Microsoft SQL Server is a relational database management system developed by Microsoft. As a database server, it is a software product with the primary function of storing and retrieving data as requested by other software applicationsâwhich may run either on the same computer or on another computer across a network.
templates.note: Password needs to include at least 8 characters including uppercase, lowercase letters, base-10 digits and/or non-alphanumeric symbols.

templates.title: Microsoft SQL Server (Windows)
templates.name: Microsoft-SQL-Server-Windows
templates.description: Microsoft SQL Server is a relational database management system developed by Microsoft. As a database server, it is a software product with the primary function of storing and retrieving data as requested by other software applicationsâwhich may run either on the same computer or on another computer across a network.
templates.note: Password needs to include at least 8 characters including uppercase, lowercase letters, base-10 digits and/or non-alphanumeric symbols.

templates.title: SQL Server Express (Windows)
templates.name: SQL-Server-Express-Windows
templates.description: SQL Server Express is a free edition of SQL Server, ideal for development and production for desktop, web and small server applications.
templates.note: Password needs to include at least 8 characters including uppercase, lowercase letters, base-10 digits and/or non-alphanumeric symbols.

templates.title: Redis Cluster
templates.description: Open-source in-memory data structure store - Cluster mode

templates.title: CockroachDB
templates.description: CockroachDB cluster
templates.note: Deploys an insecure CockroachDB cluster, please refer to CockroachDB documentation for production deployments.

templates.title: CommandBox
templates.name: CommandBox
templates.description: CommandBox is a Command Line Interface (CLI), package manager, embedded CFML server, application scaffolding and much more.

templates.title: Jenkins
templates.name: Jenkins
templates.description: Jenkins is an open source automation server. It helps automate the parts of software development related to building, testing, and deploying, facilitating continuous integration and continuous delivery. It is a server-based system that runs in servlet containers such as Apache Tomcat.

templates.title: GitLab CE
templates.name: GitLab CE
templates.description: GitLab can be installed in most GNU/Linux distributions, and with several cloud providers. To get the best experience from GitLab, you must balance performance, reliability, ease of administration (backups, upgrades, and troubleshooting), and the cost of hosting.

templates.title: Registry
templates.name: Registry
templates.description: The Registry is a stateless, highly scalable server side application that stores and lets you distribute Docker images.

templates.title: Datadog Agent
templates.name: Datadog-Agent
templates.description: The Datadog Agent is software that runs on your hosts. It collects events and metrics from hosts and sends them to Datadog, where you can analyze your monitoring and performance data. The Datadog Agent is open source and its source code is available on GitHub.

templates.title: Datadog Agent
templates.name: Datadog-Agent
templates.description: The Datadog Agent is software that runs on your hosts. It collects events and metrics from hosts and sends them to Datadog, where you can analyze your monitoring and performance data. The Datadog Agent is open source and its source code is available on GitHub.

templates.title: Sematext Agent
templates.name: Sematext-Agent
templates.description: Sematext Agent is a modern, container-native monitoring agent for Docker. It runs as a tiny container on every Docker host and provides automatic collection and processing of Docker Metrics and Events for all cluster nodes and all auto-discovered containers.

templates.title: Sematext Agent
templates.name: Sematext-Agent
templates.description: Sematext Agent is a modern, container-native monitoring agent for Docker. It runs as a tiny container on every Docker host and provides automatic collection and processing of Docker Metrics and Events for all cluster nodes and all auto-discovered containers.

templates.title: UptimeKuma
templates.name: UptimeKuma
templates.description: A Free Open-Source Self-Hosted Monitoring Tool.

templates.title: Alpine
templates.name: Alpine
templates.description: Alpine Linux is a Linux distribution designed to be small, simple and secure. Unlike most other Linux distributions, Alpine uses musl and BusyBox instead of the more commonly used Glibc and GNU Core Utilities and OpenRC for its init system instead of systemd.

templates.title: AmazonLinux
templates.name: AmazonLinux
templates.description: Amazon Linux provides a stable, secure, and high-performance execution environment for applications.

templates.title: ArchLinux
templates.name: ArchLinux
templates.description: Arch Linux is an independently developed, x86-64 general-purpose Linux distribution that strives to provide the latest stable versions of most software by following a rolling-release model. The default installation is a minimal base system, configured by the user to only add what is purposely required.

templates.title: Debian
templates.name: Debian
templates.description: Debian, also known as Debian GNU/Linux, is a Linux distribution composed of free and open-source software, developed by the community-supported Debian Project, which was established by Ian Murdock on August 16, 1993.

templates.title: Debian (Stable)
templates.name: Debian-Stable
templates.description: Debian, also known as Debian GNU/Linux, is a Linux distribution composed of free and open-source software, developed by the community-supported Debian Project, which was established by Ian Murdock on August 16, 1993.

templates.title: Debian (Stable)(Slim)
templates.name: Debian-Stable-Slim
templates.description: Debian, also known as Debian GNU/Linux, is a Linux distribution composed of free and open-source software, developed by the community-supported Debian Project, which was established by Ian Murdock on August 16, 1993.

templates.title: OracleLinux
templates.name: OracleLinux
templates.description: Oracle Linux is a Linux distribution packaged and freely distributed by Oracle, available partially under the GNU General Public License since late 2006. It is compiled from Red Hat Enterprise Linux source code, replacing Red Hat branding with Oracle's.

templates.title: Ubuntu
templates.name: Ubuntu
templates.description: Ubuntu is a Linux distribution based on Debian and composed mostly of free and open-source software. Ubuntu is officially released in three editions: Desktop, Server, and Core for Internet of things devices and robots.

templates.title: Dokku
templates.name: Dokku
templates.description: Own your PaaS using tools you already know. Powered by Docker, you can install Dokku on any hardware. Use it on inexpensive cloud providers. Use the extra cash to buy a pony or feed kittens. You'll save tens of dollars a year on your dog photo sharing website.

env.name: DOKKU_HOSTNAME
env.label: Dokku hostname
env.description: Global hostname to be registered by Dokku

env.name: DOKKU_HOST_ROOT
env.label: Dokku host root
env.description: Image build cache path. Generally set to <data dir> + '/home/dokku'

templates.title: Dokku
templates.name: Dokku
templates.description: Own your PaaS using tools you already know. Powered by Docker, you can install Dokku on any hardware. Use it on inexpensive cloud providers. Use the extra cash to buy a pony or feed kittens. You'll save tens of dollars a year on your dog photo sharing website.

env.name: VERSION
env.label: Dokku version
env.description: Version of Dokku to use ('latest' if empty)

env.name: DOKKU_HOSTNAME
env.label: Dokku hostname
env.description: Global hostname to be registered by Dokku

env.name: VOLUME_PATH
env.label: Dokku volume path
env.description: Host path to be bound to /mnt/dokku (`/var/lib/dokku` if empty)

env.name: DOKKU_HOST_ROOT
env.label: Dokku host root
env.description: Image build cache path. Generally set to <data dir> + '/home/dokku'

env.name: SSH_PORT
env.label: SSH port
env.description: Host port to expose SSH port of Dokku (22 if empty)

env.name: HTTP_PORT
env.label: HTTP port
env.description: Host port to expose HTTP port of Dokku (80 if empty)

env.name: HTTPS_PORT
env.label: HTTPS port
env.description: Host port to expose HTTPS port of Dokku (443 if empty)

templates.title: NodeJS (Debian)
templates.name: NodeJS-Debian
templates.description: Node.js is an open-source, cross-platform, back-end JavaScript runtime environment that runs on a JavaScript Engine and executes JavaScript code outside a web browser, which was designed to build scalable network applications.

templates.title: NodeJS (Debian)(Slim)
templates.name: NodeJS-Debian-Slim
templates.description: Node.js is an open-source, cross-platform, back-end JavaScript runtime environment that runs on a JavaScript Engine and executes JavaScript code outside a web browser, which was designed to build scalable network applications.

templates.title: NodeJS (Alpine)
templates.name: NodeJS-Alpine
templates.description: Node.js is an open-source, cross-platform, back-end JavaScript runtime environment that runs on a JavaScript Engine and executes JavaScript code outside a web browser, which was designed to build scalable network applications.

templates.title: Python (Debian)
templates.name: Python-Debian
templates.description: Python is a high-level, interpreted, general-purpose programming language. Its design philosophy emphasizes code readability with the use of significant indentation.

templates.title: Python (Debian)(Slim)
templates.name: Python-Debian-Slim
templates.description: Python is a high-level, interpreted, general-purpose programming language. Its design philosophy emphasizes code readability with the use of significant indentation.

templates.title: Python (Alpine)
templates.name: Python-Alpine
templates.description: Python is a high-level, interpreted, general-purpose programming language. Its design philosophy emphasizes code readability with the use of significant indentation.

templates.title: Elasticsearch
templates.name: Elasticsearch
templates.description: Elasticsearch is a search engine based on the Lucene library. It provides a distributed, multitenant-capable full-text search engine with an HTTP web interface and schema-free JSON documents.

templates.title: Solr
templates.name: Solr
templates.description: Solr is an open-source enterprise-search platform, written in Java. Its major features include full-text search, hit highlighting, faceted search, real-time indexing, dynamic clustering, database integration, NoSQL features and rich document handling.

templates.title: Nginx
templates.name: Nginx
templates.description: Nginx, stylized as NGINX, is a web server that can also be used as a reverse proxy, load balancer, mail proxy and HTTP cache. The software was created by Igor Sysoev and publicly released in 2004. Nginx is free and open-source software, released under the terms of the 2-clause BSD license.

templates.title: Httpd
templates.name: Httpd
templates.description: The Apache HTTP Server is a free and open-source cross-platform web server software, released under the terms of Apache License 2.0. Apache is developed and maintained by an open community of developers under the auspices of the Apache Software Foundation.

templates.title: Caddy
templates.name: Caddy
templates.description: The Caddy web server is an extensible, cross-platform, open-source web server written in Go. The name Caddy refers both to a helper for tedious tasks, and a way to organize multiple parts into a simplified system.

templates.title: Minio
templates.name: Minio
templates.description: MinIO is a High Performance Object Storage released under GNU Affero General Public License v3.0. It is API compatible with Amazon S3 cloud storage service. It can handle unstructured data such as photos, videos, log files, backups, and container images with the maximum supported object size of 5TB.

templates.title: Scality S3
templates.name: Scality-S3
templates.description: What is S3 Scality? S3 Compatible Storage is a storage solution that allows access to and management of the data it stores over an S3 compliant interface.

templates.title: File Browser
templates.name: File-Browser
templates.description: FileBrowser provides a file managing interface within a specified directory and it can be used to upload, delete, preview, rename and edit your files. It allows the creation of multiple users and each user can have its own directory. It can be used as a standalone app.

templates.title: RabbitMQ
templates.name: RabbitMQ
templates.description: RabbitMQ is an open-source message-broker software that originally implemented the Advanced Message Queuing Protocol and has since been extended with a plug-in architecture to support Streaming Text Oriented Messaging Protocol, MQ Telemetry Transport, and other protocols.

templates.title: Mautic
templates.description: Open-source marketing automation platform

templates.title: Redmine
templates.description: Open-source project management tool
templates.note: Default user and password are admin/admin

templates.title: Portainer Agent
templates.description: Manage all the resources in your Swarm cluster
templates.note: The agent will be deployed globally inside your cluster and available on port 9001.

templates.title: OpenFaaS
templates.name: func
templates.description: Serverless functions made simple
templates.note: Deploys the API gateway and sample functions. You can access the UI on port 8080. Warning: the name of the stack must be 'func'.

templates.title: IronFunctions
templates.description: Open-source serverless computing platform
templates.note: Deploys the IronFunctions API and UI.

templates.title: Microsoft OMS Agent
templates.description: Microsoft Operations Management Suite Linux agent.

templates.title: Wordpress
templates.description: Wordpress setup with a MySQL database
templates.note: Deploys a Wordpress instance connected to a MySQL database.

templates.title: CockroachDB
templates.description: CockroachDB cluster
templates.note: Deploys an insecure CockroachDB cluster, please refer to CockroachDB documentation for production deployments.

templates.title: FDO
templates.description: FDO
